column5: I picked up this nice buck on a nearby trib last week.  After measuring the length at 32 3/4 inches I was convinced it was a very big fish.      After measuring the girth at 18 inches and doing so me quick math, I realized this fish would only go 13 lbs 3 oz.  Still a beauty but my weight guessing seems a bit off of late.  I could only imagine what a 43lb record bow would feel like!  I get the feeling that mark will never be bested by a wild fish.  T
Nice catch.  Fairly dark fish with great colours.  I wouldn't worry too much about its weight, it's a great catch.
Great report and pics Doctrt  The measurements alone is good enough for me.... WTG Thanks for sharing Leechman
I wouldn't get too hung up on the never ending "how much does a fish weigh" argument..I catch a tonne of steelies, and I would consider that a great catch any day
That is a salmon pretending to be a trout. So he can flirt with all other female trout.  What a size! Great catch!
Very chunky fish, my PB is longer than that by quite  a bit but I am sure that fish outweighs it. They never seem to weigh as much as you would think haha  great fish
Hold the fish out when taking a picture and the weight jumps to 17lbs.
